law.catch_line: Politics of candidate not to be indicated -- Definition of election booth.

text.section: No election officer or other person within an election booth shall tell or indicate to a voter the political affiliation of any candidate.
An election booth means an area in which a voter casts his vote which is designed in such a manner that the secrecy of the vote is insured.

law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 429, effective July 13, 1990. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4399-25.
